page.title: 01General Information
page.content: The area surveyed is mainly pasture land. It is undulating countryside, crisscrossed with narrow lanes enclosed by high banks and hedges. Though beautiful and situated almost in the centre of Devon, midway between the two great moors, Dartmoor and Exmoor, it is rarely mentioned in guides to the trappings of the tourist trade. Until recently, the population were mostly born and bred within a ten mile radius and, even today, the majority are Devonians although the area's proximity to Exeter has led to the population becoming more mixed, both in occupation and origin.
